meanings.definition: Convert (pictures or sound) into a digital form that can be processed by a computer.
meanings.sent1: I am digitizing my old photos to save them on my computer.
meanings.sent2: The company is digitizing their music collection for easier access.
meanings.sent3: Digitizing these pictures feels like bringing them to life in a new way.
meanings.sent4: She was digitizing memories, turning them into bits and bytes.
meanings.sent5: Digitizing the images made them clearer and more vibrant than before.

meanings.definition: Represent (an object, image, sound, etc.) by generating a digital code.
meanings.sent1: The artist is digitizing her painting to share it online.
meanings.sent2: Digitizing the map helped in creating a virtual tour of the city.
meanings.sent3: Digitizing the sound of a cat meowing could be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: He was digitizing the world around him, turning reality into code.
meanings.sent5: The process of digitizing the sculpture revealed intricate details.

meanings.definition: To convert (data) into digital form for use in a computer.
meanings.sent1: Digitizing the text made it easier to search for specific words.
meanings.sent2: The librarian is digitizing the library catalog for online access.
meanings.sent3: Digitizing the grocery list felt like giving it a technological makeover.
meanings.sent4: She was digitizing information, turning it into ones and zeros.
meanings.sent5: The process of digitizing data improved its accessibility and organization.
